abstract.p: International Business Machines Corp and nine companies create e2open.com, global business-to-business marketplace for computer, electronics and telecommunications industries (S)

block.p: International Business Machines Corporation and nine companies have created e2open.com -- a global business-to-business e-marketplace for the computer, electronics and telecommunications industries. The other companies are Hitachi, LG Electronics, Matsushita Electric (Panasonic), Nortel Networks, Seagate Technology, Solectron, Toshiba, Ariba and i2.

The marketplace will bring together thousands of companies to plan, manage and execute supply-chain transactions over the Internet. Today, the companies account for about $700 billion of goods and services bought and sold in the worldwide electronics industry's supply chain.

International Business Machines Corporation and nine companies have created e2open.com -- a global business-to-business e-marketplace for the computer, electronics and telecommunications industries. The other companies are Hitachi, LG Electronics, Matsushita Electric (Panasonic), Nortel Networks, Seagate Technology, Solectron, Toshiba, Ariba and i2.

The marketplace will bring together thousands of companies to plan, manage and execute supply-chain transactions over the Internet. Today, the companies account for about $700 billion of goods and services bought and sold in the worldwide electronics industry's supply chain.

Operations are expected to begin by mid-July, with additional functions within 12 months. John Mumford, a founding partner of Crosspoint Venture Partners, will be acting chief executive of e2open.com and oversee start-up operations.
